post.summary:
The first endpoint required to perform a global change for personnel.
Global Change for Personnel provides the ability to change agency personnel associated with
customers, policies, suspense, personal notes and alerts throughout the system in a time-efficient manner.
Employee changes to books of business can be accomplished with this one-time process rather than changing items individually.
This is important when job assignments change or an employee leaves the agency.
            
Before starting the Global Change for Personnel process, it is recommended that you process or delete all suspended billings and
unposted Direct Bill Statements prior to running the utility.
This is because Global Change cannot work on customer/policies that have unposted transactions on them.
Because the process makes permanent changes to the database, Vertafore recommends running a full backup prior to running.

parameters.name: GCPSetupPostRequest
parameters.description: Contains all fields and options for setting up a global change for personnel process.

delete.summary: Deletes the header and detail records for a global change for personnel process that has not yet been started.

parameters.name: GlobalChangeHeaderId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for global change process details to be deleted.

get.summary: Gets all of the global change personnel processes for an agency that have been set up, but not yet started.

post.summary:
The second endpoint required to perform a global change for personnel.
Given the header ID for a process that has been set up, this will start the process, executing all permanent changes.

parameters.name: GCPStartPostRequest
parameters.description: Contains the identifier for a global change process.

get.summary: Gets the status of an existing global change for personnel process.

parameters.name: GlobalChangeHeaderId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for a global change process.

CompanyResponse.title: CompanyResponse
CompanyResponse.description:
REST model for AFW_Company
The Company table collects information for companies doing business with 
the agency.Five different types of companies are supported:  Insurance, Finance, 
Brokerage, Fee and   Writing Companies. Only Insurance and Brokerage companies 
support writing companies.  
A company may be deleted if the company has not been used in a transaction.  
Doing so results in a soft delete setting the Status field to 'D'.  
The trigger will also soft delete associated writing companies and CompanyAddress 
records and hard delete the Underwriter, DefaultAgencyCommission, MasterAgent, 
Download Address APTInsurer, CompanyPlan and CompanyBillOptions tables. 
The company trigger also handles changes to a parent's IsHide flag and sets the 
writing companies IsHide flag to be consistent with its parent.

companyCode.description:
Parent company or Brokerage company for which the policy is written with.  
Foreign key maintained in the Company table as a unique identifier of a company. 
For Subscription Policy CoCode=^^^.  The CoType column determines what value is stored.  
If CoType = N then this is a normal company code, if type = B then this is a 
Brokerage company code. For Subscription CoType=S.
From AFW_Company.CoCode.

companyId.description:
A unique identifier that is more unique than CoCode. 
Now you can use it as a foreign key next to other entities and not get duplicate char(3) codes
From AFW_Company.CoId

name.description:
Name of Insurance, Finance,  Brokerage, Fee or Writing Company.  
No duplicate names allowed across all types except can have duplicate writing 
company names with different parent company.

naic.description:
National Association of Insurance Commissioners Company Code (NAIC Company Code). 
Used in download. The company code and NIAC code combination must be unique.

The type and number of addresses needed for any one company is unique to that company.  
All company types with exception of writing companies must have at least one address defined.

If CoType = N then this is a normal company code, if type = B then this is a 
Brokerage company code. For Subscription CoType=S.
From AFW_Company.CoCode.

CustomerResponse.title: CustomerResponse
CustomerResponse.description:
The Customer Table (short-name = Cust) contains all the agency's customers, prospects and suspects.
In order to write a customer record, the following fields are required:  CustId, CustNo,
LastName, Status, Type, PrintCustStmt, StatePrintGroup, ARClosedDate, ARClosedStatus,
MktgFlag, IsExclDelete, IsBillNameSameAsCust, IsBillAddrSameAsCust, IsPrintAgencyBill,
IsPrintDirectBill, PremOption, and GroupingOption.
A unique CustId is generated upon insert to create the single field primary key.
At the same time that a unique CustId is generated, a unique CustNo is also generated
to create the single field alternate key.
This is intended to be a very basic model for Customer Information,
no Personal Identifiable Information (PII) should be returned with this model.
If more info is needed a new model should be created.
Note: Email is PII but it is an exception in this case

custId.description: Unique identifier for a row in the Customer table.

sortName.description: Display the customer individual name (LastName + FirstName + MiddleName) or the customer firm name (FirmNameCust).

contactName.description:
Display the customer individual name (LastName + FirstName + MiddleName) or the
customer firm name (FirmNameCust).

secondaryContactName.description: The name of the dependent or contact if the phone number is not directly associated with the customer.

secondaryContactType.description:
The type of contact the SecondaryContactName applies to if the phone number
is not directly associated with the customer.

secondaryEmail.description: An alternate email address for the customer

custNo.description:
Alternate key to uniquely identify a customer.
This is a displayable field may be used for the user to uniquely identify
a customer in the interface.  At the time a new CustId is generated, a new CustNo is generated.

    M - "Master/Multiple Entities",
    S - "Sub-customer/Multiple Entities"
Default is D

trackReceivables.description:
Track the account receivables at Master or Sub-customer
Values are
    "M" - track at the master customer
    "S" - track at the sub-customer
This is required if the customer is a Master customer
and ignored if a Standard or Sub-customer

masterCustomerId.description:
The CustomerId of the MasterCustomer

CustomerAccountingOptionsPostRequest.title: CustomerAccountingOptionsPostRequest
CustomerAccountingOptionsPostRequest.description: Model of the Customer's accounting options

printStatement.description:
Will a statement be printed for this customer
Default is true

statementPrintGroup.description:
The Print Group of this customers statement
Default is the Main print group
Values are from the 61 PrString List

receivablesReporting.description:
How reports display invoice detail for this customer
Values from the AR list
    B - "Balance Brought Forward"
    O - "Open Invoice Detail"
Default is B

printAgencyBillInvoices.description:
Should Agency Bill invoices be printed
Default true

printDirectBillInvoices.description:
Should Direct Bill Invoices be printed
Default true

premiumOption.description:
Option to roll feed and premium to a single line on invoices
Values from PRE List
    D - Use Agency Default
    P - Print premium by LOB and tran; non premium by charge type. Summarize installments by LOB and charge type.
    N - Print premium by LOB and tran; non premium by charge type. Do not summarize installments.
    S - Summarize premium into one line and print non premium by charge type.
    T - Summarize premium and non premium together.
Default is D

groupingOption.description:
Option to group different invoice numbers
Values from GRP List
    D - Use agency default
    P - Print each invoice number on a separate invoice form
    S - Print invoice numbers for the same policy on the same invoice form
    T - Print all invoice numbers (multiple policies) on the same invoice form
Default is D

applyLateCharge.description:
Will a late charge be applied to the customer if late
Default is true

includeInAgedArCollectionLetter.description:
Will the customer be included in an Aged A/R list for a collection letter if late
Default is true

autoApplyReceipts.description:
Will Receipts from this customer automatically be applied to the oldest invoice
Values from AAP List
    A - Use Agency default
    Y - Automatically apply receipts to oldest invoice
    N - Do not automatically apply receipts to oldest invoice
Default is A

ActiveFormsGetRequest.title: ActiveFormsGetRequest
ActiveFormsGetRequest.description: Model containing filter criteria for getting active ACORD forms.

latestOnly.description: True to return only the latest editions of the forms, false return all active editions. The default is false.

description.description:
The description of the ACORD form to use to show to the user.
This is usually the name of the form as displayed on the form from ACORD,
for instance for the 125 it would be "Commercial Insurance Applicant Information".

number.description:
The specific ACORD Form number for instance 125 for the Commercial Applicant Information Section
Note: The latest available edition will/should always be used

state.description: The state can be null or empty in which case it is non-state specific or US

edition.description: The edition of the ACORD form in the format of MM/YYYY

mapRuleIdList.description:
The name or id of the map rule used to pull data form the database
and place it on the ACORD form. For fully converted ACORD forms
there is only one rule per form, for older UFF/XFDl hybrid forms
there is one rule per page. They will be in page order

resourceIdList.description:
The Name/ID of the ACORD Form background resource.
This must be retrieved form the map rule file since
not all entries are in the database. For fully converted ACORD forms
there is only one resource per form, for older UFF/XFDl hybrid forms
there is one resource per page. They will be in page order

hasACORDFieldNames.description:
True if the from is based on an ACORD XFDL with ACORD eLabled
fields. For instance "Producer_Name_A".

False if the form is mapped using UFF files (or hybrid UFF/XFDL). 
In this case the field names will be in the format of "FIELD_XXX" where XXX 
is a number 500 or greater.

isMappedToDatabase.description:
True if the form is fully mapped (not a partially mapped form),
otherwise false.
Partially mapped forms only maps commonly filled out fields.

elfFormVersionId.description:
This uniquely identifies the form that you want to create.
Should be used if a specific form is known.

AcordDataPostRequest.title: AcordDataPostRequest
AcordDataPostRequest.description:
Model used to request ACORD Form data for a specific ACORD Form from a policy.
The policy number can be null or empty in which case the latest active policy will be used.

customerId.description: Unique identifier, CustId, for a row in the AFW_Customer table.

policyId.description:
Unique identifier, PolId, for a row in the AFW_BasicPolInfo table.
The policy number can be null or empty in which case the latest active policy will be used.

formNumber.description:
The specific ACORD Form number for instance 125 for the Commercial Applicant Information Section
The latest available edition will always be used

formState.description:
The state can be null or empty in which case non-state specific will be used,
unless there is none or in the case as state requested does not exist,
in which case the state the policy is addressed at will be used.
If none of those work the form will return as null.

lineOfBusinessIds.description: List of line of business ids on a policy

AcordFormResponse.description:
Placeholder class for creating response model for ACORD Form Mapping (subject to change)
This is for the Form object

The list of XML serialized forms to be outputted.
This is set from the constructor.

GCPSetupPostRequest.title: GCPSetupPostRequest
GCPSetupPostRequest.description: Contains all fields and options for setting up a global change for personnel process.

personnelType.description:
This field determines the shared classification type between the From and To Personnel.
The available options are Exec, Rep, Broker, or Sales Center Rep.
You can change only one Type of personnel per process run.
For example, an Personnel can be both a Primary Exec and a Secondary Exec for the same customer.
A change to that Personnel can be made in one run of Global Change with Exec as the selected Type.
If, however, the same Personnel is both the Exec and the Rep on a policy, and you want to change
the Personnel for both types, you must run Global Change twice, once for Type Exec and once for Type Rep.

fromPersonnelCode.description:
The unique 3-character code for the personnel you want to change from.
The personnel must match the given personnel type and have a status of Active or Retired.

toPersonnelCode.description:
The unique 3-character code for the personnel you want to change to.
The personnel must match the given personnel type and have a status of Active or Retired.

customerSearchCriteria.title: GCPCustomerSearchCriteriaModel
customerSearchCriteria.description: Options chosen in this area define the customers of the From Personnel that you want to include in the change process.

includeCustomerAndOrPolicyChanges.description:
Choose whether to change only customers, both customers and policies, or neither customers nor policies.
The available options are Customers, Both, and Neither with Both being the default if nothing is chosen.

customerSelections.title: GCPCustomerSelectionsModel
customerSelections.description: Options to further filter the customers included in the global change process.

policySelections.title: GCPPolicySelectionsModel
policySelections.description: Options to further filter the policies included in the global change process.

includePersonalSuspenseChanges.description:
True by default, this option causes suspense to be reassigned to the To Personnel.
Personal Suspense items are those not attached to a customer, policy, or claim.
Forced to be false if the selected Personnel Type is Broker.

changeCustomerSuspense.description:
Change customer/policy level suspense: Choose one or none of the following options.
"All": Change all suspense for the From Personnel regardless of customer selections.
"Selected": Change all suspense for the From Personnel that match the customer selections.
"None": Change no customer/policy level suspense.
By default, this field is set to "All".

includeAlertChanges.description:
True by default, this option causes alerts from the From Personnel to be reassigned to the To Personnel.
Changes Alerts where the From Personnel is either the Designated Personnel or the Designated Backup.
Forced to be false if the selected Personnel Type is Broker.

includePersonalNoteChanges.description:
True by default, this option causes notes from the From Personnel to be reassigned to the To Personnel.
Personal Notes are Notes that are not attached to a customer, policy or claim.
Forced to be false if the selected Personnel Type is Broker.

GCPCustomerSearchCriteriaPostRequest.title: GCPCustomerSearchCriteriaPostRequest
GCPCustomerSearchCriteriaPostRequest.description: Defines the customers to include in the global change for personnel process.

includeCustomerChanges.description: Option to include changes to customers of type C or Customer. True by default.

includeProspectChanges.description: Option to include changes to customers of type P or Prospect. True by default.

includeSuspectChanges.description: Option to include changes to customers of type S or Suspect. True by default.

includeBrokerCustomerChanges.description:
Option to include customers from brokers of the From Personnel.
By default, all broker customers of the From Personnel are included regardless of personnel type.
If the personnel type is Broker, then this option is forced to be true.

brokerCodeToIncludeBrokerCustomers.description:
The broker of the From Personnel to include the customers of.
By default, all customers of all the From Personnel's brokers are included.
This field should be used to narrow down the brokers to only the one desired.

businessWithAgency.description: Optional type of business filter on customers.

businessUnit.title: BusinessUnitModel
businessUnit.description:
Optional business unit filter on customers.
If only changing the personnel on customers that have a policy business unit match,
the business unit selection for Customer Selections and Policy Selections must be the same.

GCPCustomerSelectionsPostRequest.title: GCPCustomerSelectionsPostRequest
GCPCustomerSelectionsPostRequest.description: Contains the customer selection criteria for starting a global change for personnel process.

changeCustomersBasedOnRange.description:
Set this option to true to select a group of customers based on a defined range.
Enter alpha-numeric text in the CustomersRangeStart and CustomersRangeEnd fields to define the range.
Example: Use this option to assign an Exec or Rep to an alphabetical range of customers.
All customers with a Firm Name or Last Name beginning with the letters A-H, for example.

customersRangeStart.description: The lower limit of the range used to select customers. Filters based on customer Firm Name or Last Name.

customersRangeEnd.description: The upper limit of the range used to select customers. Filters based on customer Firm Name or Last Name.

changeCustomersBasedOnSelection.description: Set this option to true to select customers that belong to the From personnel based on a provided list of customer IDs.

customerIdsSelection.description: A list of customer IDs used for selecting the customers to be changed.

GCPPolicySelectionsPostRequest.title: GCPPolicySelectionsPostRequest
GCPPolicySelectionsPostRequest.description: Contains the policy selection criteria for starting a global change for personnel process.

includePolicyLevelPolicies.description:
True by default, this option changes policies where the From personnel exists only on the policy.
Personnel can be assigned at the Policy level that are not assigned at the Customer level.
If true, all policy instances involving the From Personnel are changed, even if the Personnel is not assigned at the Customer level.

businessUnit.title: BusinessUnitModel
businessUnit.description:
Optional business unit filter on policies.
If only changing the personnel on policies that have a customer business unit match,
the business unit selection for Policy Selections and Customer Selections must be the same.

typeOfBusiness.description: Optional type of business filter on policies.

includePersonnelReassignmentDate.description:
True by default, this option enables the use of a chosen Personnel Reassignment Date for changed policies.
If false, the reassignment date is set to the expiration date of the policy.
Forced to be false if the selected Personnel Type is Broker.

personnelReassignmentDate.description:
The date to flag the From Personnel as Inactive on changed policies and flag the To Personnel as Active.
If Include Personnel Reassignment Date is set to true, defaults to the current date.
Forced to be null if the selected Personnel Type is Broker.

excludeExpiringPolicies.description:
If the given Personnel Reassignment Date is greater than the current date, this option becomes relevant.
For any selected policies expiring during this date window (from the current date to the given reassignment date),
the default option is to set the reassignment date equal to the policy expiration date.
However, if this option is set to true, you can Exclude such Expiring Policies from the change process.

setZeroFromPersonnelCommissionAmounts.description:
True by default, this option causes the From Personnel commission amounts
to be set to zero for invoices effective on or after the reassignment date.
Forced to be true if the selected Personnel Type is Broker.

setDefaultToPersonnelCommissionAmounts.description:
True by default, this option causes the To Personnel commission amounts to be set to the 
From Personnel default amount for invoices effective on or after the reassignment date.
Forced to be true if the selected Personnel Type is Broker.

indicator if a paticular process completed.

Unique identifier for a row in the Employee table.
Employee code associated with the 'From' employee.

toPersonnel.description:
Unique identifier for a row in the Employee table.
Employee code associated with the 'To' employee.

includeCustomerAndOrPolicyChanges.description: Flag to indicate if the customer and/or policy options were selected for change.

includePersonalNoteChanges.description: Flag to indicate if the notes option was selected for change.

includeAlertChanges.description: Flag to indicate if the alerts option was selected for change.

businessUnitCustomers.title: BusinessUnitCodesModel
businessUnitCustomers.description:
Optional business unit filter on customers.
If only changing the personnel on customers that have a policy business unit match,
the business unit selection for Customer Selections and Policy Selections must be the same.

includeTypeCustomerChanges.description: Flag to indicate if Customers are included in the process.

includeTypeProspectChanges.description: Flag to indicate if Prospects are included in the process.

includeTypeSuspectChanges.description: Flag to indicate if Suspects are included in the process.

includeBrokerCustomerChanges.description: Flag to indicate if Broker's Customers are included in the process.

changeCustomersBasedOnRange.description:

customersRangeStart.description: Start of alpha - numeric range for customer selection.

customersRangeEnd.description: End of alpha - numeric range for customer selection.

changeCustomersBasedOnSelection.description: Flag to indicate if customer selection is multi-select.

includePolicyLevelPolicies.description:
Flag to indicate if all customers matching the customer search critieria are to
be changed or ishould the change be limited to just the selected customers.

typeOfBusinessCustomers.description:
Flag to include customers in the process based on the customer's type of
business.

typeOfBusinessPolicies.description: Flag to include policy's in the process based on the policy's type of business.

personnelReassignmentDate.description:
The date and time associated with when the 'From' employee becomes inactive and
the 'To' employee becomes active.

excludeExpiringPolicies.description: Flag to indicate if future dated polices are to be included in the process.

setZeroFromPersonnelCommissionAmounts.description:
Flag to indicate the commission requirements of the 'From' employee, for
invoices effective on or after the inactive date.

setDefaultToPersonnelCommissionAmounts.description:
Flag to indicate the commission requirements of the 'To' employee, for invoices
effective on or after the active date.

includePersonalSuspenseChanges.description: Flag to indicate if the personal suspense option was selected for change.

changeCustomerSuspense.description: Flag to indicate if the customer/policy suspense option was selected for change.

enteredDate.description: Date and time the row was originally created.

runDate.description: Date and time associated with the start of the Global Change process.

This table records the various selections for each run of Global Change for
Personnel. The table also records counts representing the number of records
found to be processed, the number of records actually proccessed as well as an
indicator if a paticular process completed.

This table contains the detailed information of the records changed during a run
of Global Change for Personnel as well as any exceptions incurred during the
process.

Filters returned invoices by billing method.

Filters returned invoices by posted status. See (PostedStatus) for more detailed information
The "PostedStatus" property takes precedence over this property if it is set

dueDateEnd.description: Filters returned invoices to only invoices with a due date before the specified date.

This property takes precedence if set over the "Posted" property

invoiceId.description:

A company assigned number used to identify a policy.  If the agency does 
not have a number for a policy/application, they will assign a temporary number.

policyId.description: Unique identifier, PolId, for a row in the AFW_BasicPolInfo table.

invoiceNumber.description:
The system generated Source Reference number of the Sales Journal 
transactions that recorded the posting of this invoice.

billMethod.description:
Identifies how the invoice will post.  Agency Bill and Direct Bill invoices post to different GL accounts.
Valid values are:
    A = Agency Bill
    P = Direct Bill

invoiceEffectiveDate.description: This is the date entered by the user or, in the case of installments, calculated from the payment plan.

dueDate.description: Due date of invoice when posted

isPosted.description:

isCancelled.description: Flag to identify Invoice is canceled

postedStatus.description:
Flag to indicate the status of the row posting for GL.
Determines if this record has any transactions attached
to it that have been posted.

InvoiceTransactionResponse.title: InvoiceTransactionResponse
InvoiceTransactionResponse.description:
Every line of business, fee and charge has a InvoiceTransaction
for each installment of the invoice

invoiceTransactionId.description: Unique identifier of a row in the InvoiceTransaction table.

policyTransactionEffectiveDate.description:
Identifies an endorsement date for a policy.  The date part of this field
contains the date of the endorsement.  The time part contains an increment for
the number of transactions within the day, starting with 12:00 am and
incrementing by one second for each multiple transactions within the day.

amount.description:
This is the dollar amount for this transaction.  This may be a portion of the
Policy Transaction Premium amount when invoicing has a pay plan other than Full
Pay.

type.description:
Policy transaction type.  The PoltEffDate and PolId  used against
AFW_PolicyTransaction.TranType

billingCode.description:
Agency entered short length description field that identifies the type of charge
or credit.

lineOfBusinessCode.description:
Policy transaction Line of Business.  This is null when the invoice transaction
is for a non premium policy transaction.

Description of the Billing Transaction as entered or confirmed by the user on
the Billing Transaction dialog.  The value in this field defaults based on the
LineOfBus and POLT description.  It may be overriden on the dialog by the user.

When the invoice is created by EMS directBillInvoiceCollection endpoint

customerId.description: Unique identifier, CustId, for a row in the AFW_Customer table.

policyId.description: Unique identifier, PolId, for a row in the AFW_BasicPolInfo table.

invoiceEffectiveDate.description:
This is the date entered by the user or, in the case of installments, calculated from the payment plan.
Optional field, will default to PolicyTransaction.TransactionEffectiveDate or PaymentInfo.InvoiceDistributions.DistributionEffectiveDate if the date is not provided.

invoiceDate.description:
Optional Date of Invoice
Defaults to today
Time is ignored
InvoiceDate must be within the term of the policy (Policy Effective Date - Policy End Date)

policyOrigin.description: Optional one-character code indicating the origin-type of the policy.

Optional.
If provided, only Specialty Data details with matching effective date will be returned.
NOTE: If the policy is endorsed on the same date, each endorsement on the policy will reflect the same date with seconds incremented by one.
To capture the non-endorsed policy details for any date, supply the effective date and any value to millisecond component to the time.
If omitted, only Specialty Data details with the latest effective date will be returned for non-unique data records (endorsed/changed policies, etc.)

SpecialtyDataEntryDetailResponse.title: SpecialtyDataEntryDetailResponse
SpecialtyDataEntryDetailResponse.description:
A Specialty Data Entry is a subset of the larger group of System Data Entry.
System Data Entry is assigned to a Line Of Business as a way to define the way that
additional Line Of Business data is entered by an agent.
            
Specialty Data is synonymous with "Custom Data," which has been defined by the agency.
This is most notably the Questions/Answers for insured Lines Of Business that
don't fit the pre-defined System Data Entries that the agency is setup with.

dataEntryName.description: The friendly name or description given to this Specialty Data Entry (defined by an Admin, shows in UI)

specialtyLocations.description:
Location-specific data (notably Questions/Answers related to the Location)
    NULL when section is disabled for this Specialty Data Entry
    EMPTY when section is enabled, but no data was entered

specialtyRisks.description:
Risk-specific data (notably Questions/Answers related to the Risk)
    NULL when section is disabled for this Specialty Data Entry
    EMPTY when section is enabled, but no data was entered

specialtyCoverages.description:
Coverage-specific data associated to the System Data on the Line Of Business
    NULL when section is disabled for this Specialty Data Entry
    EMPTY when section is enabled, but no data was entered

specialtyUnderwritings.description:
Underwriting-specific data (notably Questions/Answers related to the Underwriting)
    NULL when section is disabled for this Specialty Data Entry
    EMPTY when section is enabled, but no data was entered

specialtyAdditionalInterests.description:
Additional Interest-specific data associated to the System Data on the Line Of Business
    NULL when section is disabled for this Specialty Data Entry
    EMPTY when section is enabled, but no data was entered

specialtyRemarks.description:
Remarks entered pertaining to the Specialty Data entered overall
    NULL when section is disabled for this Specialty Data Entry
    EMPTY when section is enabled, but no data was entered

specialtyLocationRemarks.description: Remarks entered pertaining to the Specialty Line of Business Location overall

The following two classes are used in both EMS and ONS. 
If you make changes, you need to update both and release at the same time.

2.0: WSAPI using MiddleTier 3.0

Sending this simply for possible validation check in EMS

Optional date filter. If provided, only returns policies that were in-term during that date.
A policy is in-term during its term, i.e., from the effective date to the expiration date.

policyStatus.description:
The status of the policy.
Values: Cancelled (C), Non-Renewed (N), Renewed (R), Active (A), Expired (E), Quote (Q), Not taken (T), Rewritten (W), Include (I).
Either the full value or the one-character code are accepted.

isCurrentlyInForce.description:
Option to only include policies that are in-force as of today.
A policy is in-force during its term (from the effective date to the expiration date) and
if the policy's status is either Active, Renewed, Rewritten, or the default/Include status.

includeAllPolicyTypes.description: Option to include all types of policies: Policies, Submissions, and Service Agreements.

issuedState.description:
Indicates what Issue State is associated with a policy (default is: Customer's
State)

policyId.description: Unique identifier for a policy.

customerId.description: Unique identifier for a customer.

companyCode.description:
Parent company or Brokerage company for which the policy is written with.  
Foreign key maintained in the Company table as a unique identifier of a company.

companyName.description:
Name of Insurance, Finance,  Brokerage, Fee or Writing Company.  No duplicate
names allowed across all types except can have duplicate writing company names
with different parent company.

writingCompanyCode.description:
This field is initially defaulted to the CompanyCode (parent company).  
The user can accept the default or specify a Writing company for the 
company or brokerage specified in CompanyCode. This field is required on a policy.

policyNumber.description:
A company assigned number used to identify a policy.  If the agency does 
not have a number for a policy/application, they will assign a temporary number.

policyEffectiveDate.description:
The date the policy becomes effective.  The effective date may be changed up to one day before 
the first endorsement effective date. This is enforced through the data entry form.  
The column is required for a policy and submission.  This date will always equal the 
EffectiveDate of the first PolicyTransaction record for this policy.
Must be less than PolicyExpirationDate.

csrCode.description: The Account Rep for the policy.

executiveCode.description: The Account Exec for the policy.

lineOfBusiness.description:
It is policy's main line of business such as Monoline, Package, or Business Owner Policy
If you need to retrieve lines of businesses associated with the policy, please use GET /policies/lines-of-business.

policySubType.description:
Flag that indicates if the row is for a policy, submission or an accounting
policy (generated when processing a direct bill statement).

renewalReportStatus.description:
Determines if the policy should be included on the Renewal Report. The Code
field from the PrCode table is stored in this field.

PoliciesEndorsePostRequest.title: PoliciesEndorsePostRequest
PoliciesEndorsePostRequest.description:
Contains models for endorsing multiple policies.
Includes optional default values that can be shared by the collection.

policyEndorsements.description: The models containing data for endorsing multiple policies.

defaultTransactionType.description:
The default value of the TransactionType property for each policy endorsement in the PolicyEndorsements collection.
Will be overridden per endorsement in the collection if a value is given to the TransactionType property of that suspense.

defaultDescription.description:
The default value of the Description property for each policy endorsement in the PolicyEndorsements collection.
Will be overridden per endorsement in the collection if a value is given to the Description property of that suspense.

updatePolicyExpirationDatesForNonRenewal.description:
Only having selected the Non-renewal transaction type, this setting causes any related
policy's expiration date to be updated to the respective policy endorsement effective date.
True/on by default.

updatePolicyStatusesToNotRenewedForNonRe.description:
Only having selected the Non-renewal transaction type, this setting causes any related
policy's status to be updated to "Non-renewed".
True/on by default.

clearPolicyStatusesForReversalOfNonRenew.description:
Only having selected the Reversal of non-renewal transaction type, this setting causes any related
policy's current status of "Non-renewed" to be cleared/reset back to the default status.
True/on by default.

Optional TransactionEffectiveDate returns historical data, otherwise the latest is returned

Otherwise the latest Policy Transaction less than or equal to the Requested TransactionEffectiveDate
will be used.

Optional date filter. If provided, only returns policies that were in-term during that date.
A policy is in-term during its term, i.e., from the effective date to the expiration date.

The status of the policy.
Values: Cancelled (C), Non-Renewed (N), Renewed (R), Active (A), Expired (E), Quote (Q), Not taken (T), Rewritten (W), Include (I).
Either the full value or the one-character code are accepted.

isCurrentlyInForce.description:
Option to only include policies that are in-force as of today.
A policy is in-force during its term (from the effective date to the expiration date) and
if the policy's status is either Active, Renewed, Rewritten, or the default/Include status.

Must be less than PolicyExpirationDate.

csrCode.description: The Account Rep for the policy.

executiveCode.description: The Account Exec for the policy.

lineOfBusiness.description:
It is policy's main line of business such as Monoline, Package, or Business Owner Policy

field from the PrCode table is stored in this field.

Deprecated - This property is not part of the policy info

SuspensePostRequest.title: SuspensePostRequest

customerId.description:
DO NOT USE THIS PROPERTY!
When calling from a new process, use the EntityId instead.

policyId.description: Unique identifier for the Policy.

policyEffectiveDate.description:
The date the policy becomes effective.  The effective date may be changed up to one day before 
the first endorsement effective date. This is enforced through the data entry form.  
This field is required for a policy and submission.  This date will always equal the 
Effective Date of the first Policy Transaction record for this policy.  Must be less than Policy Expiration Date.

companyCode.description: 3 character code that identifies the parent company or brokerage company writing the policy.

dueDate.description: Date the Suspense item is due

assignToEmployeeCode.description: Identifies who the suspense item is suspended to.

entityId.description:
EntityId will contain the ID or Code for the Center.
Bank = BankCode; Broker = BrokerCode; Company = CoCode; Customer = CustId; Employee = EmpCode; User = EmpCode; Vendor = VendorCode

entityType.description:
Suspenses can be attached to multiple Centers not just Customer. The following is the EntityType code used for each Center attachment.
1 = Bank; 2 = Broker; 3 = Company; 4 = Customer; 5 = Employee; 8 = User; 9 = Vendor;

assignedByEmpCode.description: This field identifies the employee who inserted the suspense row into the database and is a display only field.

PolicyContactCanonicalPostRequest.description: Please see Realtime Data Exchange Canonical Models reference.

carrierPolicyNumber.description:
The external party Policy Number (this could be something like "POL1234" or a Guid)
AMS360 will attempt to use this along with the CarrierPolicyEffectiveDate and NAIC in order to find the matching AMS360 PolicyId
in order to perform an add of Policy Contact if no matching contact is found to update (and EntityId is not provided)

carrierPolicyEffectiveDate.description:
The external party Policy Effective Date
AMS360 will attempt to use this along with the CarrierPolicyNumber and NAIC in order to find the matching AMS360 PolicyId
in order to perform an add of Policy Contact if no matching contact is found to update (and EntityId is not provided)

naic.description:
The external NAIC code
AMS360 will attempt to use this along with CarrierPolicyNumber and CarrierPolicyEffectiveDate in order to find the matching AMS360 PolicyId
in order to perform an add of Policy Contact if no matching contact is found to update (and EntityId is not provided)

entityId.description: The external id of the entity the contact is attached to (AMS360 assumes this to be the PolicyId if provided)

policyId.description: The AMS360 policy id that the contact is attached to

accountId.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The External AccountId

address.title: AddressModel
address.description: The model containing the contact address

createdOn.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The external date of the contact creation

description.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The external description of the contact

emailAddresses.description: The list of email address models for the contact (AMS360 will only use one)

familyName.description: The last name of the contact (AMS360 will combine this with GivenName)

givenName.description: The first name of the contact (AMS360 will combine this with FamilyName)

id.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The unique Id of the contact

isPrimary.description:
(This property is not used by AMS360) 
Identifies the Primary responsible.
Valid values are:
    Y = Yes
    N = No

phoneNumbers.description:
The list of phone numbers for the contact.
AMS360 has specific Phone Number types that it must match on in order to be stored,
otherwise it will try using one marked as Primary:
    Business - Business Phone
    Residence - Residence Phone
    Mobile - Cell Phone
    Pager - Pager Phone Number
    Fax - Fax Phone Number

primary.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) If the contact is a primary contact

tenantId.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The Id of the external tenant

type.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The contact type

updatedOn.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The external date of a contact update

preferredContactMethod.description:
The Preferred Method of Contact for this Policy Contact
Values supported by AMS360:
    Business Phone
    Cell
    Text Message
    Residence Phone
    Fax
    Pager
    Other
    Customer Address
    Email #1 
    Email #2
    Intl Phone #1
    Intl Phone #2

description.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The external description of the contact address

accountId.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The external AccountId of the contact address

country.description: The Country Code of the address (i.e. US)

formattedAddress.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The formatted full address

mailing.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) Denotes if this is a mailing address

preferred.description: Denotes if this address is preferred

Denotes if this email is preferred over others.
AMS360 will take this email if true (or first email in the list if all true or all false for all emails)

type.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) The type of the email

canReceiveFax.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) Denotes if this number can receive a fax

canReceiveText.description: (This property is not used by AMS360) Denotes if this number can receive text messages

countryCode.description: The country code for the phone number (i.e. 1 for US)

extension.description: The extension (if any) for the phone number

phoneNumber.description: The phone number itself, including area code (may be formatted)

preferred.description: Denotes if this phone number is preferred over others

type.description:
AMS360 keys off of this value in order to store the phone into the DB
Valid values are:
    Business
    Residence
    Mobile
    Pager
    Fax
